sen.j: 小貫氏（おぬきし）は日本の氏族の一つ。
sen.e: Onuki clan was one of the Japanese clans.
Onuki clan was one of the Japanese clans.
Onuki clan was one of the Japanese clans.

sen.j: 家系は藤原北家の藤原魚名の流れを汲み、平将門を征伐した鎮守府将軍藤原秀郷の末裔にあたる。
sen.e: The family line was descended from FUJIWARA no Uona in the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and Onuki clan was a descendant of the Commander-in-Chief of the Defense of the North FUJIWARA no Hidesato, who subjugated TAIRA no Masakado.

The family line was descended from FUJIWARA no Uona in the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and Onuki clan was a descendant of the Commander-in-Chief of the Defense of the North FUJIWARA no Hidesato, who subjugated TAIRA no Masakado.

The family line was descended from FUJIWARA no Uona in the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and Onuki clan was a descendant of the Commander-in-Chief of the Defense of the North FUJIWARA no Hidesato, who subjugated TAIRA no Masakado.

sen.j: 秀郷より20代目にあたる小野崎氏第13代当主小野崎通春の次男・通伯が常陸国久慈郡小貫村にあって小貫通伯を名乗った。
sen.e: Michihaku ONOSAKI, the second son of the 13th family head Michiharu ONOSAKI, who was the 20th head of the family after Hidesato, introduced himself as Michihaku Onuki in Onuki-mura, Kuji District, Hitachi Province.

Michihaku ONOSAKI, the second son of the 13th family head Michiharu ONOSAKI, who was the 20th head of the family after Hidesato, introduced himself as Michihaku Onuki in Onuki-mura Village, Kuji District, Hitachi Province.
sen.cmt: Onuki-mura→Onuki-mura Village muraが何か分からないので変更しました。
sen.e: Michihaku ONOSAKI, the second son of the 13th family head Michiharu ONOSAKI, who was the 20th head of the family after Hidesato, introduced himself as Michihaku Onuki in Onuki-mura Village, Kuji District, Hitachi Province.

sen.j: 異説として、秀郷より4代藤原公通の三男通近を小貫氏の祖とするものもある。
sen.e: According to a different opinion, Michichika, the third son of FUJIWARA no Kinmichi, four generations from Hidesato, was the ancestor of Onuki clan.
According to a different opinion, Michichika who was the third son of FUJIWARA no Kinmichi, the four generations from Hidesato, was the ancestor of Onuki clan.
sen.cmt: コンマで区切られた文章が多く、どの文章を修飾しているのか分かりにくいので、 who wasに修正しました。fourの前にtheを追加しました。
sen.e: According to a different opinion, Michichika who was the third son of FUJIWARA no Kinmichi, the four generations from Hidesato, was the ancestor of Onuki clan.

sen.j: 平安期、小野崎氏宗家の小野崎通盛・小野崎通長が佐竹氏に臣従して以来、小野崎氏は佐竹氏の譜代家臣として遇されてきたが、小野崎氏が佐竹氏の重臣としての地位を確立した戦いが「佐竹の乱」である。
sen.e: During the Heian period after the head family of Onosaki clan, Michimori ONOSAKI and Michinaga ONOSAKI served Satake clan, Onosaki clan was treated as the hereditary vassal of Satake clan, and Onosaki clan established the position as a senior vassal of Satake clan in the Battle of Satake.

During the Heian period, although the Onosaki clan was treated as the hereditary vassal of Satake clan since Michimori ONOSAKI and Michinaga ONOSAKI who were the head family of Onosaki clan had been serving the Satake clan, Onosaki clan established the position as a senior vassal of Satake clan in the 'Battle of Satake'.
sen.cmt: 原文と訳文の語順や接続詞の使い方に不適切な点があったので、全文で主に語順を変更し、接続詞を追加しています。「」が訳にありません。→ 'Battle of Satake'
sen.e: During the Heian period, although the Onosaki clan was treated as the hereditary vassal of Satake clan since Michimori ONOSAKI and Michinaga ONOSAKI who were the head family of Onosaki clan had been serving the Satake clan, Onosaki clan established the position as a senior vassal of Satake clan in the 'Battle of Satake'.

sen.j: 15世紀、佐竹惣領家と有力一族である山入氏との間の抗争が繰り返され、その戦いは100年間にも渡ったが、小野崎氏はこの戦いに積極的に参加し、元の国人領主としての立場から様々な曲折を経ながらも最終的に佐竹宗家を支持した。
sen.e: In the 15th century government family of Satake clan repeatedly struggled with the influential family the Yamairi clan, and the struggle continued over 100 years; Onosaki clan positively participated in this dispute, and after many twists and turns as the position of the original local samurai lord, Onosaki clan finally supported the head family of Satake clan.

In the 15th century, government family of Satake clan repeatedly struggled with the influential family the Yamairi clan, and the struggle continued over 100 years; the Onosaki clan positively participated in this dispute and after many twists and turns as the position of the original local samurai lord, the Onosaki clan finally supported the head family of Satake clan.
sen.cmt: centuryの後にコンマを追加しました。Onosakiの間にtheを追加しました。dispute後のコンマを削除しました。
sen.e: In the 15th century, government family of Satake clan repeatedly struggled with the influential family the Yamairi clan, and the struggle continued over 100 years; the Onosaki clan positively participated in this dispute and after many twists and turns as the position of the original local samurai lord, the Onosaki clan finally supported the head family of Satake clan.

sen.j: 結果、小野崎氏は山入氏と完全に袂を分かち、永正元年（1504年）の山入氏の滅亡に貢献、100年の内乱は終熄した。
sen.e: As a result, Onosaki clan completely parted with Yamairi clan, and contributed to the collapse of Yamairi clan in 1504, leading to the end of domestic conflict for 100 years.
As a result, the Onosaki clan completely parted with Yamairi clan and contributed to the collapse of Yamairi clan in 1504, therefore, it led to the end of domestic conflict for 100 years.
sen.cmt: , leading to～の文章のつなげ方が間違っているので、therefore以降と文章の接続部分を変更しました。
sen.e: As a result, the Onosaki clan completely parted with Yamairi clan and contributed to the collapse of Yamairi clan in 1504, therefore, it led to the end of domestic conflict for 100 years.

sen.j: 山入氏居城の久米城には石神小野崎氏の通重が入ったが、その子の通安・通室ともに子がなかったため、同族の小貫頼重の子・定春が名跡を継いだ。
sen.e: Ishigami Onosaki clan Michishige ONOSAKI entered Kume-jo Castle, which had been the castle of Yamairi clan; because his children Michiyasu and Michimuro did not have a child of their own, Sadaharu the child of the same family Yorishige ONUKI succeeded to the family name.

Michishige from Ishigami-onosaki clan entered Kume-jo Castle, which had been the castle of Yamairi clan, because his sons Michiyasu and Michimuro did not have a child of their own, Sadaharu the son of the same family Yorishige ONUKI succeeded to the family name.
sen.cmt: Ishigami Onosaki clanは二つの氏かと混同するのではという懸念からIshigami-onosaki clanに変更しました。Michishige ONOSAKIと訳出されていますが、原文には石神小野崎氏の通重となっているので変更しました。;→削除しました。children→sonsに変更しました。
sen.e: Michishige from Ishigami-onosaki clan entered Kume-jo Castle, which had been the castle of Yamairi clan, because his sons Michiyasu and Michimuro did not have a child of their own, Sadaharu the son of the same family Yorishige ONUKI succeeded to the family name.

tit.e: Sengoku (Age of Civil Wars) and Azuchi-Momoyama Period
Sengoku (Age of Civil Wars) and Azuchi-Momoyama Period
Sengoku (Age of Civil Wars) and Azuchi-Momoyama Period

sen.j: 佐竹氏の内乱以降、小野崎氏は佐竹氏一門衆にも列し、小貫氏も宿老として活躍している。
sen.e: After the domestic conflict of Satake clan, Onosaki clan took its place among the Satake family, and Onuki clan also played an active part as chief vassals.
After the domestic conflict of Satake clan, Onosaki clan took its place among the Satake family, and Onuki clan also played an active part as chief vassals.
After the domestic conflict of Satake clan, Onosaki clan took its place among the Satake family, and Onuki clan also played an active part as chief vassals.

sen.j: 佐竹氏全盛期の佐竹義重 (十八代当主)・佐竹義宣 (右京大夫)時代には和田昭為、一門筋に当たる人見藤道とともに佐竹家の三家老を勤めた小貫頼久を輩出する。
sen.e: During the days of Yoshishige SATAKE (the 18th head of the family) and Yoshinobu SATAKE (Master of the Western Capital Offices) at the height of its prosperity Onuki clan produced Yorihisa ONUKI, who assumed office as one of the three chief retainers of Satake family together with Akitame WADA and the same family Fujimichi HITOMI.

During the days of Yoshishige SATAKE (the 18th head of the family) and Yoshinobu SATAKE (master of the Western Capital Offices) at the height of its prosperity, the Onuki clan produced Yorihisa ONUKI, who assumed office as one of the three chief retainers of the Satake family together with Akitame WADA and Fujimichi HITOMI who was from the same family.
sen.cmt: (Master~)→master小文字に変更しました。Onuki clanが主語だと思われますが、at the height of its prosperity Onuki clanとなっているのでコンマとtheを追加しました。Sateke familyの前にtheを追加しました。the same family Fujimichi HITOMI→単語の羅列なので、Fujimichi HITOMI who was from the same familyに変更しました。.
sen.e: During the days of Yoshishige SATAKE (the 18th head of the family) and Yoshinobu SATAKE (master of the Western Capital Offices) at the height of its prosperity, the Onuki clan produced Yorihisa ONUKI, who assumed office as one of the three chief retainers of the Satake family together with Akitame WADA and Fujimichi HITOMI who was from the same family.

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）の関ヶ原の戦いで、主君佐竹義宣が東軍参加を渋ったことから、戦後処理で常陸国54万5000石から出羽国20万5000石に減封されるに伴い、頼久も主家に従い、秋田に転籍した。
sen.e: Because the lord Yoshinobu SATAKE was unwilling to join Eastern Camp in the Battle of Sekigahara of 1600, in postwar treatment SATAKE was transferred in his territory from Hitachi Province with 545,000 koku crop yields to Dewa Province with 205,000 koku crop yields; accordingly Yorihisa followed his master family and transferred to Akita.

Because the lord Yoshinobu SATAKE was unwilling to join the Eastern Camp in the Battle of Sekigahara of 1600, the territory of Satake was diminished from the Hitachi Province with 545,000 koku crop yields to the Dewa Province with 205,000 koku crop yields due to the postwar treatment and accordingly Yorihisa followed his master family and was transferred to Akita.
sen.cmt: Eastern Campの前にtheを加えました。postwarの前のスペースを削除しました。2回目のSATAKEは名字だけなので小文字に変更しました。原文「減封」の訳出があいまいです。→transferred in his territoryを削除し、変更しています。in postwar treatment→due to theに変更し、位置を変更しました。;→andに変更しました。transferred受身にする必要があるのでwas transferredに変更しました。
sen.e: Because the lord Yoshinobu SATAKE was unwilling to join the Eastern Camp in the Battle of Sekigahara of 1600, the territory of Satake was diminished from the Hitachi Province with 545,000 koku crop yields to the Dewa Province with 205,000 koku crop yields due to the postwar treatment and accordingly Yorihisa followed his master family and was transferred to Akita.

sen.j: そのため、小貫氏は茨城県、秋田県に多い姓である。
sen.e: Therefore, Onuki clan is found in Ibaraki Prefecture and Akita Prefecture in large numbers.
Therefore, Onuki clan is found in Ibaraki Prefecture and Akita Prefecture in large numbers.
Therefore, Onuki clan is found in Ibaraki Prefecture and Akita Prefecture in large numbers.

sen.j: 江戸時代には、秋田藩譜代重臣として軍事方、奉行、勘定方、剣術指南役などを輩出している。
sen.e: In the Edo Period Onuki clan produced military officers, bugyo (magistrate), kanjogata (accounting officer) and swordplay masters as chief vassals of hereditary daimyo of Akita Domain.
In the Edo Period, Onuki clan produced military officers, Bugyo (magistrate), Kanjogata (accounting officer) and swordplay masters as chief vassals of hereditary daimyo of Akita Domain.
sen.cmt: Periodのあとにコンマを追加しました。bugyo,kanjogata→は自前利を大文字に変更しました。
sen.e: In the Edo Period, Onuki clan produced military officers, Bugyo (magistrate), Kanjogata (accounting officer) and swordplay masters as chief vassals of hereditary daimyo of Akita Domain.

sen.j: 秋田藩小貫家には、剣術・砲術等の免許皆伝書などの多くの古文書が残存している。
sen.e: There remain many ancient documents such as a document proving full proficiency in swordplay or gunnery in Onuki family of Akita Domain.
Many ancient documents remained, such as documents that proved full proficiency in the swordplay or gunnery in the Onuki family of Akita Domain.
sen.cmt: There remain→文法ミスです。document proving→documents that provedに変更しました。Onukiの前にtheを追加しました。
sen.e: Many ancient documents remained, such as documents that proved full proficiency in the swordplay or gunnery in the Onuki family of Akita Domain.

sen.j: また、常陸に残った一部が水戸徳川家に仕官した。
sen.e: Some people of Onuki clan who remained in Hitachi served Mito Tokugawa family.
Some people of Onuki clan who remained in Hitachi served the Mito Tokugawa family.
sen.cmt: Mitoの前にtheを追加しました。
sen.e: Some people of Onuki clan who remained in Hitachi served the Mito Tokugawa family.
